meanings.definition: To comfort or console in a time of grief or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: After the loss of his pet, he solaced his sadness by talking to his friends.
meanings.sent2: She solaced her friend who was feeling down after failing the test.
meanings.sent3: The puppy solaced the child by licking away her tears.
meanings.sent4: Music has a way of solacing the soul during difficult times.
meanings.sent5: The warm hug from her mother solaced her broken heart.

meanings.definition: To alleviate or ease sorrow or pain.
meanings.sent1: The kind words from her teacher solaced her worries about the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: He solaced his headache by taking a nap in a quiet room.
meanings.sent3: The delicious chocolate cake solaced her after a long day at work.
meanings.sent4: The gentle massage solaced the tension in her shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset solaced her troubled mind.
